You precisely follow the given Task and use the Data when provided. When Data is not provided, create some examples.

# Task

You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.



# Data

extract_julia_code("""```julia
println("hello world")
```""")

Here is how you can solve this problem:

```julia
function extract_julia_code(md)
    lines = split(md, "\n")
    code_blocks = String[]

    for line in lines
        if startswith(line, "```julia")
            start_index = findfirst(isequal('`'), line)[1] + 3
            end_index = findlast(isequal('`'), line)[end] - 1
            code = line[start_index:end_index]
            push!(code_blocks, code)
        elseif startswith(line, "```") && !isempty(code_blocks)
            join(code_blocks, "\n")
            return
        end
    end

    return nothing  # in case there is no julia code block
end
```

This function goes through each line of the markdown document and checks if it's a start or end of the julia code block. If it's a start, it extracts the content inside the fences (both inclusive), pushes that into an array `code_blocks`, and ignores any other lines. When it sees a new code block, it joins all elements in the `code_blocks` array with a newline character (`"\n"`). If there is no end of julia code block found at all, then it returns nothing.
